entry.title: Burning of the Clocks 2011
entry.summary:
Burning the Clocks acts as an antidote to the excesses of a commercial Christmas - people gather together to make paper and willow lanterns to carry through their city and burn on the beach as a token for the end of the year. No lantern is better for its purpose than any other, all are unique to the maker and precious but all are given up to be burnt to greet the lengthening days.

Caption: Spinning Dresses

entry.title: Alfie's first smiles
entry.summary:
Alfie's started giving us beaming toothless grins. Rather rewarding.

Caption: Alfie smiling

entry.title: Bonfire Night at Sam and Aimi's
entry.summary:
Bonfire night in Sam and Aimi's back garden.

Caption: Firework in a pot

entry.title: White Night Alternative Village Fete
entry.summary:
From the Facebook invite: This a fete re-imagined for the hours of darkness - expect ghouls, vamps (of both the blood favouring and 40’s starlet variety), kitsch popstars, rocka-hillbillies, retro hepkats and kittens. Visitors to the Fete are invited to express their twilight alter egos by dressing fancy for the occasion. Come out and play!

Caption: Shadows around the circle

entry.title: Beach of the dead 2011
entry.summary:
A trip to see Beach of the Dead 2011 - the Brighton zombie parade. It was certainly quite surreal to see most of the centre of town full of zombies, probably more so for the people who weren't aware of the event.

Caption: Cowgirl zombie 2

entry.title: Alfie's Early Days
entry.summary:
A compilations of photos taken over the first month and a half of Alfie's life.

Caption: Alfie

entry.title: Brighton Breeze 2011 - VW Camper Rally
entry.summary:
A trip with Alfie and his Granmamie and Granpapie to Brighton Breeze 2011; a VW Type 2 Camper meetup on Madiera Drive. The weather was beautiful, so were the camper vans. This gallery mostly contains pictures of campers but there's one or two of babie Alfie thrown in as well.

Caption: Blue Volkswagen Type 2 split screen

entry.title: Visit from Granmamie and Granpapie
entry.summary:
Lisa's parents visit us in Brighton to spend some time with baby Alfie.

Caption: Family portrait

entry.title: Alfie's first week
entry.summary:
My son Alfie Thomas Simkin was born August 25th 2011 at the Royal Sussex County Hospital, Brighton. He weighed 5lb 6oz - he's not premature, but he is tiny! This album was taken over his first week in the big wide world. In the hospital we had to forumla feed, but we've since got him back on the breast, and that's where he is now (literally).

Caption: Cute face

entry.title: Brighton Gay Pride 2011
entry.summary:
Gay pride in Brighton is a big event. Probably the city's biggest regular outdoor event in fact. This year was the first year that they've tried charging for the main event in Preston Park. Of course, the parade is free. This year's theme was "Out of this world". These photos are of what I saw of Pride as someone who's not willing to pay the £12 entrance fee for the park(which I think is too high). I'm also not hugely fond of the way a massive green fence has been up around the park for the last week either.

Caption: Pride not profit!

entry.title: Kew Gardens 2011-07-05
entry.summary:
A trip to Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew for Lisa's 24th birthday. Includes a walk around the Princess of Wales conservatory, the Palm House, the Davies Alpine House and the new tree-top walkway designed by Marks Barfield Architects. Unfortunately the weather wasn't ideal and the desert room was full of tacky Mexican crap, but I still managed to get some decent pictures nevertheless.

Caption: Path through the princess of wales conservatory

entry.title: Infinity Foods' 40th Birthday
entry.summary:
Infinity foods (a health food shop in Brighton) hosted an event in Jubilee Square to celebrate their 40th birthday. There were food stalls (mostly vegan and vegetarian), bands playing and a bar.

Caption: Infinity Foods products 2

entry.title: Bee Orchid at Cuckmere 2011-06-12
entry.summary:
Outside the visitor's centre at Cuckmere Haven during the Celebrate Cuckmere exhibit 10-19th June 2011 there was a rare bee orchid growing right next to the path. A minature protective fence had been placed around it along with a sign explaining its importance and requesting that people do not touch.

Caption: Bee Orchid Flower

entry.title: Full Moon Calling 2011-05-17
entry.summary:
A trip to Full Moon Calling, the Poi and Fire Spinning meet on Brighton beach outside the King Alfred Leisure centre. The following is copied from the Facebook event: "This is not a party party, but a celebration of the moon, fire and elements of the universe. We all get together to demonstrate the powerful elements of the poi and drums. On this night a community of children and adults meet to enjoy a relaxed ambient atmosphere warm by a fire."

Caption: Circles of fire across Brighton beach

entry.title: Caitlin and Logan on the Railway Trail
entry.summary:
A quick walk along the South Downs Railway Trail with Caitlin and Logan. Logan's particularly cute playing peek-a-boo.

Caption: Logan playing peek-a-boo

entry.title: Hope Gap and visiting Carolyn
entry.summary:
A trip to Hope Gap to visit Carolyn to plan for the Celebrating Cuckmere exhibition at the Seven Sisters country park in June.

Caption: Seaford Head Chalk Cliff 3

entry.title: Brighton Congathon and Glee Flashmob
entry.summary:
Went to see Brighton Dance Flash Mobs perform their Glee routine at the Brighton Pier Congathon event. Then watched an Elvis impersonator and a band on stilts performed at the conga finish line. The Conga took 10-15 minutes to go from the entrance of the pier, to the end and back again.

Caption: Arms to the left

entry.title: Snow in Bartlow 2010-12-19
entry.summary:
During a period of heavy snow in December 2010, a little wander around the village of Bartlow in Cambridgeshire. Includes photographs of St Mary's Church, The Three Hills public house, Barlow Post office and various cottages in the village.

Caption: Curving path cut out of the snow

entry.title: Purple Lisa 2010-12-19
entry.summary:
Lisa's new purple hair out in the snow.

Caption: Lisa

entry.title: Flowers for Rosie
entry.summary:
A celebration of the life of Rosie Grafen, 22nd January 1988 - 16th October 2010.

Caption: Lily close-up

entry.title: Linton 2010-10-21
entry.summary:
A quick tour of the village of Linton in Cambridgeshire, including shots of St Mary's Church, the Waggon & Horses, the Dog & Duck and The Crown Inn.

Caption: St Mary's Church wide-angle with graves

entry.title: Lisa 2010-10-10
entry.summary:
Some photos of Lisa I took as the sun was setting and we were sitting in a field in Bartlow.

Caption: Lisa

entry.title: Bartlow 2010-10-10
entry.summary:
A late afternoon stroll around the village of Bartlow in Cambridgeshire just as the autumn colours are starting to appear on the trees.

Caption: Orange and yellow leaf closer

entry.title: Haze and Jobbo
entry.summary:
A trip to Audley End with Hazel and Jobbo.

Caption: Haze hooping

entry.title: Brighton Pier 2010-09-25
entry.summary:
A trip to Brighton Pier (what used to be the Palace Pier) on a warm autumn day with dramatic clouds.

Caption: Seagull and coin-operated telescope

entry.title: Chilli Festival and Stanmer Park
entry.summary:
A trip to Brighton Chilli Festival in Victoria Gardens. During the chilli festival Barrie and I sampled some rather hot chillies, I took a few shots of Barrie's reactions. After that I went camping in Stanmer Park with Lisa, which apparently you're not supposed to do, we only got told that after a couple of nights there when we planned to leave anyway. As you can see, we pitched the tent in a nice spot.

Caption: Lisa looking down 2

entry.title: Vogue Gyratory at Night
entry.summary:
A trip out to photograph the Vogue Gyratory at night in the rain.

Caption: Bus pulling away from the Sainsburys bus stop

entry.title: Katie, Selina and Beckie come to Brighton
entry.summary:
Selina and her daughter Katie visit brighton with Beckie.

Caption: Katie

entry.title: Hope Gap with Beckie 2010-06-27
entry.summary:
Some photographs of Rooks at Hope Gap and the sun setting over the Seven Sisters during a picnic with Beckie.

Caption: Flying rook

entry.title: Birling Gap 2010-06-18
entry.summary:
A trip up Went Hill with Barrie, Beckie and Ben the golden retriever.

Caption: Barrie smoking by the side of the A27

entry.title: Beckie and Ben 2010-06-15
entry.summary:
A trip to the beach at the West side of the River Cuckmere with Beckie and her golden retriever Ben.

Caption: Ben and Beckie

entry.title: Walden and Brighton 2010-06-14
entry.summary:
Walking Ben (the Golden Retriever) with Beckie outside Saffron Walden, followed by a trip to Cuckmere Haven.

Caption: Ben in the sea

entry.title: Clarke and Saunders Parks 2010-05-23
entry.summary:
Sitting in the sun in Clarke Park, then Saunders Park with Barrie, Ellie and Daisy.

Caption: Barrie, Ellie and Daisy

entry.title: Snow at Cuckmere Haven
entry.summary:
I was the only person foolhardy enough to have driven to Cuckmere Haven in the snow, although I did encounter one other person who'd cycled. It was snowing heavily the entire time and this did present some problems keeping the camera dry and the lens clear (not to mention avoiding hypothermia - up at Hill Barn it was pretty bleak). However, I think you'll agree it was worth the risk of getting stuck in a snow drift, and happily I got home safely without incident.

Caption: Bench with snow

entry.title: Rainbows over the Cuckmere Valley
entry.summary:
When I got out of my car at the Golden Galleon public house on the West side of the Cuckmere Valley and began walking North along the River Cuckmere; I was beginning to think I'd picked the wrong place to park because the entire Western side of the Cuckmere Valley was shrouded in shadow. However, I continued walking and in return was greeted with one of those rare moments when everything seems to come together - in the last moments before sunset; clouds filled the sky, leaving a gap big enough to allow a beam of sunlight to create a stunning rainbow below the rain clouds to the East.

Caption: Full rainbow

entry.title: Late evening at Cuckmere Haven
entry.summary:
Today was the first day of decent weather we've had so far this month. I decided to take the opportunity and get some more photos with my new lens. Cuckmere Haven in December is bleak; after sunset an icy wind rips through you and there are far fewer people foolhardy enough to brave the weather.

Caption: Haven Brow

entry.title: Cuckmere Haven and the Cuckmere Valley
entry.summary:
This time I decided to park at the Golden Galleon public house and walk North along the River Cuckmere. So far I haven't really explored North of the A259 and this isn't a walk I'd done before. The weather wasn't ideal and I only got a total of about 5 minutes of good light, however I still managed to get some good pictures. I'll definitely be walking this way again as there's a particularly nice meander that I'd like to capture in better light.

Caption: Meander landscape

entry.title: Hope Gap and Cuckmere Haven
entry.summary:
A quick trip out with the 10-22mm; a short walk from the car park at Hill Barn down to the coastguard cottages and then round to Hope Gap. The warm autumn light really picks out the orange colour of Short Cliff against the brilliant white of the Seven Sisters.

Caption: Boulders and sand

entry.title: Cuckmere Haven 2009-11-07
entry.summary:
First trip out with my new 10-22mm lens.

Caption: Stile 2

entry.title: Cuckmere Haven 2009-10-10
entry.summary:
An evening trip to Cuckmere Haven - includes landscape shots in the dusk light followed by a spectacular sunset over The River Cuckmere with sheep scampering about all over the place.

Caption: Sunset with river and sheep running

entry.title: Cuckmere Haven 2009-09-25
entry.summary:
A walk along the path from the Golden Galleon public house towards the coastguard cottages. Autumn colours are out in full force - reds and browns everywhere.

Caption: Path towards the coastguard cottages with fence

entry.title: Jevington and Wilmington
entry.summary:
A tour of the villages of Jevington and Wilmington. Includes shots of St. Andrew's church - Jevington, The Eight Bells public house and Jevington Tea Garden as well as The Giant's Rest public house - Wilmington. Also includes images of various picturesque cottages and landscapes along the way.

Caption: Cottages

entry.title: Litlington and Cuckmere Haven
entry.summary:
A quick trip around the Cuckmere Valley.

Caption: Barn and Road

entry.title: Alfriston and Cuckmere Haven
entry.summary:
A quick look around the village of Alfriston, including shots of the pubs and shop-fronts, as well as St Andrew's Church. I then continued on to Cuckmere Haven for some nice photographs of the autumn colours appearing on the hills, followed by sunset over the meandering River Cuckmere.

Caption: Gate and Foxhole camping barn

entry.title: Birling Gap and Belle Toute lighthouse
entry.summary:
This time I decided to photograph dusk from Birling Gap. I parked up and walked east towards Belle Toute lighthouse. You can see autumn is coming; lots of reds and browns. There's still plenty of green there though, and in the lazy end-of-the day light; you could almost forget that a cold, harsh winter is coming.

Caption: Foliage

entry.title: Cuckmere Haven and Haven Brow
entry.summary:
The last few weeks I've been so obsessed with getting my perfect picture of the coastguard cottages that I forgot to photograph the eastern side of the River Cuckmere. Today I decided to set that right - I parked at the visitor centre and walked along the tourist path to photograph sunset from the base of Haven Brow. I'm really pleased with these images. Good results.

Caption: Rocks at the base of Haven Brow

entry.title: Haven Brow and Cuckmere Haven at Dusk
entry.summary:
Another attempt at getting my elusive perfect shot of the coastguard cottages; I parked up at Hill Barn and wandered down the track to the coastguard cottages. Almost all the elements of my perfect shot were there - the warm glow of the setting sun, the harsh direct sunlight and the blue sky and the tide was in. The clouds still weren't perfect though; I have a very specific image in my head of how I want my 'perfect' picture of the coastguard cottages to look and I didn't quite manage it this time around. I did, however, come away with some nice pictures of Haven Brow and the mouth of the River Cuckmere.

Caption: Dramatic sky over Haven Brow portrait

entry.title: Cuckmere Haven at sunset
entry.summary:
It's a clear evening when I arrive at Hill Barn and start my walk along to the coastguard cottages. The sun hangs low in the sky and casts long shadows across the ground. In some shots I struggled not to get my own shadow in the frame on some of the shots. My favourite out of these is the hay bails - this was the last light as the sun dipped behind Seaford Head and it lit the rolled up bails of hay nicely on the hillside.

Caption: Bench with long shadows

entry.title: Not in my name
entry.summary:
On the 15th February 2003 close to 2 million people took to the streets of London to voice their opposition to the invasion of Iraq. That's approximately 1 in every 50 people in England felt strongly enough to go to London and march. I was one of them. At the time there was a feeling that if this many people said no, the government might actually listen. Did they listen? Did they fuck! These are my pictures from the event, taken on 35mm.

Caption: Please don't litter

entry.title: Black and White Pavilion
entry.summary:
This is a project I shot mostly at night in the garden around Brighton Pavilion. My aim was to avoid all the obvious shots and look for more interesting angles.

Caption: Pavilion with fence

entry.title: Black and White Night
entry.summary:
This is one of the first projects I produced when I started taking photography at college back in 2002. These photographs were taken on a series of cold autumn nights around the Hollingbury district of Brighton - a couple of them in the rain and mist. This is the project that really sparked my interest in photography (and night photography in particular), and that interest has been with me ever since. Gelatin-silver prints from 35mm neg.

Caption: Bus shelter

entry.title: Life inside the machine
entry.summary:
This project is a light-hearted look at the way I, and a lot of the people I know spend most of our lives sitting in front of a computer. These are gelatin-silver prints from 35mm negs.

Caption: Supply

entry.title: Dusk on the industrial landscape?
entry.summary:
As Britain moves away from its industrial past and into a service-based economy; many of our old industrial landscapes are disappearing, changing, or re-forming. This project is a look into the changing industrial landscape of the area surrounding Shoreham power station circa 2003. These are gelatin-silver prints from 35mm negs.

Caption: Lorry in front of wall with lights and lens flare

entry.title: Walk along the river to Cuckmere Haven
entry.summary:
A walk along the path on the Western side of the River Cuckmere, to the beach and back, stopping along the way to photograph the flora and fauna.

Caption: Haven Brow and the mouth of the River Cuckmere

entry.title: Thunderstorm at Cuckmere Haven
entry.summary:
When I got in my car to drive to Cuckmere Haven the sky was blue and there was barely a cloud to be seen. I was hoping to get the shot I've been trying to get for ages - the coastguard cottages bathed in the warm glow of a setting sun. Unfortunately the weather did not cooperate. By the time I'd arrived at Hill Barn, a massive storm cloud had blown in!

Caption: Coastguard cottages and Short Cliff from the beach

entry.title: Cuckmere Haven from Hill Barn
entry.summary:
A slightly gloomy day and a short walk from Hill Barn to the coastguard cottages and back, culminating in sunset over Seaford.

Caption: Coastguard houses with fence

entry.title: A misty morning at Cuckmere Haven
entry.summary:
Arrived at Cuckmere Haven in time for sunrise again - this time I parked in the car park at the Golden Galleon public house (primarily because the main Cuckmere Haven car park is closed at that time of the morning). There was a lot of mist in the valley and the water in the lakes was very still which made for some great reflections.

Caption: The bridge over the river (A259)

entry.title: Cuckmere Haven at Dawn
entry.summary:
4:45am - a hazy sunrise over Cuckmere Haven, as seen from Short Cliff and the coastguard cottages.

Caption: A bench in front of the coastguard cottages

entry.title: Metamorphosis
entry.summary:
Whilst photographing the sunset at Cuckmere Haven I stumbled across an area of a few square meters where hundreds of Six-Spot Burnet Moths (Zygaena filipendulae) had chosen to make their chrysalises - they were literally everywhere I looked. Produced some neat pictures of the various stages of metamorphosis.

Caption: Burnet moth larvae about to form a chrysalis

entry.title: Seaford Head to Cuckmere Haven
entry.summary:
This time I parked up at Hill Barn on Seaford Head and walked down towards Hope Gap and the coastguard cottages. Waited for tide to go out and took some shots of the rock pools and the beach below Short Cliff. Then up to the Golden Galleon pub for a quick drink before heading over to the Eastern side of the river to photograph sunset.

Caption: Seven Sisters between two rocks

entry.title: Cuckmere Haven and The Seven Sisters
entry.summary:
This walk started at the hamlet of Birling Gap and headed West along six of the Seven Sisters cliffs starting with Bailey's Hill, then Flagstaff Brow, followed by Brass Point, Rough Brow, Short Brow and finally Haven Brow which marks the end of the Seven Sisters and has spectacular views down into the Cuckmere Estuary to its West.

Caption: Spectacular cliff edge

entry.title: Alciston and Litlington
entry.summary:
A little tour of the villages of Alciston and Litlington in the Cuckmere Valley. Includes shots of the village pubs, churches and various thatched houses and picturesque landscapes.

Caption: Landscape with tree

entry.title: Birling Gap to Cuckmere Haven
entry.summary:
This time I parked up at Birling Gap and walked about half of the way along the tops of the Seven Sisters cliffs towards Cuckmere Haven.

Caption: Dramatic sky with chalk and yellow horned-poppy

entry.title: D'Aubigny Road Street Party
entry.summary: Caption: Road Closed

entry.title: Cuckmere Haven 2009-06-14
entry.summary:
This time we walked the path on the West side of The River Cuckmere. This path ends at the Coastguard houses on the cliff edge and the iconic view which features in the film 'Atonement' (2007).

Caption: The view from 'Atonement'.

entry.title: Star Trails 2009-05-29
entry.summary:
Early attempts at star trail photography. We nearly decided to pack up and go home when some clouds blew over, but we were glad we didn't because it quickly cleared.

Caption: Circles around the North star

entry.title: Brighton Night Cityscapes
entry.summary:
A rainy night in Brighton town centre. I love photographing the city at night while it's wet - the lights create shimmering reflections on the pavement. On this occasion I set up my tripod in a few locations along Madiera Drive, then moved up to Church Street and took a few more shorts from outside The Dome.

Caption: Near the dome

entry.title: Saffron Walden 2009-05-31
entry.summary:
Saffron Walden is a medieval market town in Essex, close to the border with Cambridgeshire. I know the town very well - this is my tour of the town centre on a sunny day in May. Includes shots of the common, the castle, St Mary's Church, the high street, duck pond and various other landmarks.

Caption: Duck pond with bridge portrait

entry.title: Bartlow 2009-05-31
entry.summary: Caption: Bartlow Road

entry.title: Hadstock 2009-05-25
entry.summary: Caption: Piglet portrait

entry.title: Leni and Caitlin
entry.summary:
Carly's cousin Ria and her daughter Leni. Leni is 6 months old and Caitlin is 16 months old.

Caption: Leni looking cute

entry.title: Great Tew
entry.summary:
Lots of flower photographs from Great Tew, Chipping Norton. Had a nice drive out there from Oxford and a tasty lunch in the Falkland Arms and a little walk into the estate. There really were beautiful flowers everywhere and I'd have taken loads more photos if I had time. It was a windy day and getting good shots was difficult but I got a few nice ones.

Caption: Thatched Roof

entry.title: Cuckmere Haven 2009-05-11
entry.summary:
This time we walked up the cliff on the Eastern side of the river Cuckmere. There's some views of the meanders in the river, as well as some dramatic landscapes from the top of the cliff.

Caption: Path down

entry.title: Hove Park 2009-05-10
entry.summary:
Trip to Hove Park with Lisa and Sy.

Caption: Herb Robert (Geranium robertianum)

entry.title: Dyke Railway Trail - South Downs
entry.summary:
Lisa and I took Caitlin on a walk up Dyke Railway Trail outside Hangleton. While we were sitting on a bench, a Peacock butterfly fluttered around and landed several times for me to photograph. Also includes landscapes of Foredown Tower and the A27.

Caption: Lisa giving Caitlin a shoulder ride

entry.title: Corrina's Visit
entry.summary:
When Corrina visited we did a little tour of the parks - there's pictures from Hove Park, Preston Park and Stanmer Park, as well as some sunset shots from the top of Brighton Marina.

Caption: The Marina and Brighton Pier at Sunset

entry.title: Brighton Landscapes
entry.summary:
Photos from the top of Bear Road, Wilson Ave and Tenantry Down Road, as well as some beach landscapes taken from Blackrock (near the marina).

Caption: Yacht

entry.title: Cuckmere Haven 2009-04-11
entry.summary:
Spring's coming at Cuckmere Haven. Bit of a dull day, but some dramatic shots nevertheless.

Caption: Trees

entry.title: Caitlin
entry.summary:
Carly and Bob's 14 month old daughter Caitlin.

Caption: Caitlin

entry.title: Lisa
entry.summary:
Mainly Lisa

Caption: Lisa

entry.title: Saffron Walden
entry.summary:
Trip to Saffron Walden on the weekend of 14th and 15th of March.

Caption: Ferret

entry.title: Cuckmere Haven 2009-03-02
entry.summary:
This year the Environment Agency decided that they're going to stop maintaining flood defences at Cuckmere Haven. Cuckmere Haven is one of my favourite spots for outstanding natural beauty close to home in Brighton. Over the next few years this landscape will be transformed, and I plan to visit regularly to photograph the transformation.

Caption: Path

entry.title: Mostly Flowers
entry.summary:
Just a collection of random photographs mostly taken around the house and garden.

Caption: Heather

entry.title: Snow in Brighton
entry.summary:
This was the first day in years we'd had a serious covering of snow in Brighton. Lisa and I recklessly decided to drive to the top of Ditchling Beacon, then along the B2116 to Devil's Dyke and back down to Brighton. There wasn't a lot of light left when we finally found a good spot to photograph but I still came out with some good images, including the one that makes up this web design.

Caption: Road down from Ditchling Beacon

entry.title: Fire Poi
entry.summary:
Parked up not far from Brighton Marina at Black Rock. James and Lisa do fire poi on the beach in what can only be described as a chilling wind. This was the day after we had quite a few inches of snow and there was still snow on the ground in patches at the time of these shots.

Caption: Conductor

entry.title: Edinburgh
entry.summary:
Sarah and I did a trip to Edinburgh to see her friend Brett. I've been to Edinburgh twice now and really liked it both times. There's a nice atmosphere about the place that I like. Only took a few pictures on this trip but definitely planning on doing Edinburgh again.

Caption: Edinburgh Cityscape

entry.title: Devil's Dyke and Flo's Party
entry.summary:
This gallery consists of a small collection of images I shot on a day Sarah and I got the bus to the top of Devil's Dyke. The last few shots are what we were confronted with when we arrived at Jezz's house.

Caption: Devil's Dyke beacon

entry.title: Colorado
entry.summary:
My trip to Colorado. Includes shots of Sarah, Littleton, Denver, Alamosa and various towns and mountains along the route to the Great Sand Dunes National Park. Josh, Kelly and Sarah were my guides and I think they did a pretty good job of showing me the incredible natural beauty of their home.

Caption: Mountain view
